pageTitle: Itinerary for Friday, February 10, 2017 | Prime Minister of Canada
articleHtml:
Itinerary for the Prime Minister, Justin Trudeau, for Friday, February 10, 2017:

Yellowknife, Northwest Territories

8:00 a.m. The Prime Minister, the Minister of Indigenous and Northern Affairs, Carolyn Bennett, and the MP for Yellowknife, Michael McLeod, will meet with members of the Canadian Armed Forces.

Joint Task Force North
4816 49th Street
Yellowknife, Northwest Territories

Note for media:

  • Pooled photo opportunity


9:30 a.m. The Prime Minister will hold a town hall Q&A.

Multiplex Arena
41 Kam Lake Road
Yellowknife, Northwest Territories

Notes for media:

  • Open coverage
  • Media should arrive no later than 9:00 a.m.


11:15 a.m. The Prime Minister, the Minister of Indigenous and Northern Affairs, Carolyn Bennett, the Minister of Health, Jane Philpott, and the MP for Yellowknife, Michael McLeod, will visit the Aboriginal Head Start Program.

N’dilo Aboriginal Head Start
700 Orah Tili
Yellowknife, Northwest Territories

Note for media:

  • Photo opportunity


1:15 p.m. The Prime Minister, the Minister of Indigenous and Northern Affairs, Carolyn Bennett, and the MP for Yellowknife, Michael McLeod, will visit the Snowking’s Winter Festival Ice Castle.

3815 Bretzlaff Drive
Yellowknife, Northwest Territories

Note for media:

  • Photo opportunity


2:15 p.m. The Prime Minister will hold a media availability.

Mildred Hall School
5408 50 Ave,
Yellowknife, Northwest Territories

Note for media:

  • Open coverage


Note: all times local
